nodes.name: ERC20Basic

nodes.documentation:
@title SafeMath
@dev Math operations with safety checks that throw on error
nodes.name: SafeMath

nodes.documentation: @dev Multiplies two numbers, throws on overflow.
nodes.name: mul

nodes.documentation: @dev Integer division of two numbers, truncating the quotient.
nodes.name: div

nodes.documentation: @dev Subtracts two numbers, throws on overflow (i.e. if subtrahend is greater than minuend).
nodes.name: sub

nodes.documentation: @dev Adds two numbers, throws on overflow.
nodes.name: add

nodes.documentation:
@title Basic token
@dev Basic version of StandardToken, with no allowances.
nodes.name: BasicToken

nodes.documentation: @dev total number of tokens in existence
nodes.name: totalSupply
transfer
balanceOf

nodes.documentation:
@title ERC20 interface
@dev see https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20
nodes.name: ERC20
StandardToken
transferFrom
approve
allowance
increaseApproval
decreaseApproval
Ownable

nodes.documentation:
@dev The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender
account.
nodes.name: Ownable

nodes.documentation: @dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.
nodes.name: onlyOwner

nodes.documentation:
@dev Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
nodes.name: transferOwnership

nodes.documentation: @dev Empty constructor (for now)
nodes.name: Recoverable

nodes.documentation:
@dev This will be invoked by the owner, when owner wants to rescue tokens
 @param token Token which will we rescue to the owner from the contract
nodes.name: recoverTokens
tokensToBeReturned

nodes.documentation:
Standard EIP-20 token with an interface marker.
 * @notice Interface marker is used by crowdsale contracts to validate that addresses point a good token contract.
nodes.name: StandardTokenExt

nodes.documentation: How many tokens we burned
nodes.name: Burned

nodes.documentation: Burn extra tokens from a balance.
nodes.name: burn

nodes.documentation:
Upgrade agent interface inspired by Lunyr.
 * Upgrade agent transfers tokens to a new contract.
Upgrade agent itself can be the token contract, or just a middle man contract doing the heavy lifting.
nodes.name: UpgradeAgent

nodes.documentation: Interface marker
nodes.name: isUpgradeAgent

nodes.documentation:
A token upgrade mechanism where users can opt-in amount of tokens to the next smart contract revision.
 * First envisioned by Golem and Lunyr projects.
nodes.name: UpgradeableToken

nodes.documentation: Somebody has upgraded some of his tokens.
nodes.name: Upgrade

nodes.documentation: New upgrade agent available.
nodes.name: UpgradeAgentSet

nodes.documentation: Do not allow construction without upgrade master set.
nodes.name: UpgradeableToken

nodes.documentation: Allow the token holder to upgrade some of their tokens to a new contract.
nodes.name: upgrade

nodes.documentation: Set an upgrade agent that handles
nodes.name: setUpgradeAgent

nodes.documentation: Get the state of the token upgrade.
nodes.name: getUpgradeState

nodes.documentation:
Change the upgrade master.
   * This allows us to set a new owner for the upgrade mechanism.
nodes.name: setUpgradeMaster

nodes.documentation: Child contract can enable to provide the condition when the upgrade can begun.
nodes.name: canUpgrade

nodes.documentation: Define interface for releasing the token transfer after a successful crowdsale.
nodes.name: ReleasableToken

nodes.documentation: Limit token transfer until the crowdsale is over.
nodes.name: canTransfer

nodes.documentation:
Set the contract that can call release and make the token transferable.
   * Design choice. Allow reset the release agent to fix fat finger mistakes.
nodes.name: setReleaseAgent

nodes.documentation: Owner can allow a particular address (a crowdsale contract) to transfer tokens despite the lock up period.
nodes.name: setTransferAgent

nodes.documentation:
One way function to release the tokens to the wild.
   * Can be called only from the release agent that is the final ICO contract. It is only called if the crowdsale has been success (first milestone reached).
nodes.name: releaseTokenTransfer

nodes.documentation: The function can be called only before or after the tokens have been releasesd
nodes.name: inReleaseState

nodes.documentation: The function can be called only by a whitelisted release agent.
nodes.name: onlyReleaseAgent

nodes.documentation:
A token that can increase its supply by another contract.
 * This allows uncapped crowdsale by dynamically increasing the supply when money pours in.
Only mint agents, contracts whitelisted by owner, can mint new tokens.
nodes.name: MintableToken

nodes.documentation:
Create new tokens and allocate them to an address..
   * Only callably by a crowdsale contract (mint agent).
nodes.name: mint

nodes.documentation: Owner can allow a crowdsale contract to mint new tokens.
nodes.name: setMintAgent

nodes.documentation: Make sure we are not done yet.
nodes.name: canMint

nodes.documentation:
A crowdsaled token.
 * An ERC-20 token designed specifically for crowdsales with investor protection and further development path.
 * - The token transfer() is disabled until the crowdsale is over
- The token contract gives an opt-in upgrade path to a new contract
- The same token can be part of several crowdsales through approve() mechanism
- The token can be capped (supply set in the constructor) or uncapped (crowdsale contract can mint new tokens)
nodes.name: CrowdsaleToken

nodes.documentation: Name and symbol were updated.
nodes.name: UpdatedTokenInformation
CrowdsaleToken

nodes.documentation: When token is released to be transferable, enforce no new tokens can be created.
nodes.name: releaseTokenTransfer

nodes.documentation: Allow upgrade agent functionality kick in only if the crowdsale was success.
nodes.name: canUpgrade

nodes.documentation:
Owner can update token information here.
   * It is often useful to conceal the actual token association, until
the token operations, like central issuance or reissuance have been completed.
   * This function allows the token owner to rename the token after the operations
have been completed and then point the audience to use the token contract.
nodes.name: setTokenInformation

nodes.documentation: A crowdsaled token that you can also burn.
nodes.name: BurnableCrowdsaleToken

nodes.documentation:
The AML Token
 * This subset of BurnableCrowdsaleToken gives the Owner a possibility to
reclaim tokens from a participant before the token is released
after a participant has failed a prolonged AML process.
 * It is assumed that the anti-money laundering process depends on blockchain data.
The data is not available before the transaction and not for the smart contract.
Thus, we need to implement logic to handle AML failure cases post payment.
We give a time window before the token release for the token sale owners to
complete the AML and claw back all token transactions that were
caused by rejected purchases.
nodes.name: AMLToken
transferToOwner
